answers.answer: Reducing salt, trying not to gain too much weight... To me it was happening a lot a month ago and then just stopped. Maybe I am not walking that much as I used to...but still find it weird.Hope you will also stop having that kind of problems, at least for a while. ;)
btw. I am 28 (years old and weeks pregnant haha) ftm also.

Thanks, just didn't want it to get serious. I know preeclampsia has a lot to do with swelling so I was just curious. And so far I've only gained 3lbs so I'm not gaining weight quickly or a lot of weight. My next doctors appointment isn't until the 27th so I've been monitoring it and my blood pressure just in case. Ftm and Ive been a worry wort lol

question: ftm 22 weeks now. Is it normal for my feet, mainly my left one to swell everyday? And is there things I can do to reduce it? I watch what I eat and I drink water like its goin outta style and I have been propping my feet up every chance I get. Any other suggestions would be great! Thank you.
title: Swollen
